meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Let's dive into the world of Umamusume: Pretty Derby - Party Dash. I've got some... um, let's call them "expert" opinions from the critics gang over here.

According to INVEN, the game is like a party in your pants (but not too much because, well, you know). It's fun for fans and all, but maybe gets boring after a while. Yeah, who doesn't love a good horse-girl-bonanza, though?

GameGrin thinks it's an upbeat title with some quirky fun, which I agree with ( Party Dash vibes!). And Shacknews (who I'm sure has played every party game ever) says it's likeable but not mind-blowing. Shakes head.

TheSixthAxis loves the retro art direction and how it captures the energy of being a horse girl fan... while simultaneously pointing out some technical issues? What a wonderful friend!

God is a Geek says it's decent, yet somehow manages to spoil the experience with poor events and lack of tutorials? Um... what happened here?

Lastly, Noisy Pixel wishes there were more content but thinks what we've got has quality (just not enough horse-girl-frenzies to go around).

Tech-Gaming is like that one friend who's all "meh"... sorry. Four contests are bland and get stale after a few replays.

That's it! Pretty Party Dash feels... party-able?
